author: parithosh
content:
We were looking at access for the eth-clients repo and currently its just CL devs who are owners on there. The idea was that its a neutral repo thats owned by one person from each client team. It contains the canonical configs for mainnet as well as all the testnets. 

So could EL teams indicate who they want as maintainers for this org and I can add them? 

Also how do we want to deal with members who have moved on from their role as client devs? Do we want to remove their access or should we create a new role for them? Nothing would stop them from still interacting with the org as non-members of course. 

eth-clients org link for easy access: https://github.com/eth-clients

author: eikix
content:
